name: High saves tanky weaponmaster magekiller thing?
author: makiwoni

posts.author: makiwoni
posts.content:
My concept was a guy who doesn't use magic and doesn't like magic and he just has high saves against all the spell slingers around.

Is a high saves weaponmaster even possible because of all the feats already required to make a weaponmaster. I fiddled around with it and well, here's what I got. I thought human for the skill points that I can throw into spellcraft and tumble. Dwarf probably could have done better because I see the +2 saves against spells and the +2 CON but, I think I just like humans more. Fighter for all the feats and just the prestige class of weaponmaster. I also thought sword and board because more AC! and on my server the melee guys have it hard cause they need that AC and it's not possible to replace that lost shield AC. I like Epic Damage Reduction and Improved Knockdown cause I just think they're better for mage killers but, not really sure about it.

Oh my server has no blackguards / CoT and no half orcs or half elves. It being a low magic world the max items are +3 only. Lots of restricted multiclassing in druids, monks, I think clerics as well. Lots of Prestige classes are gated through lots of rp. I need at least 5 levels of a class pre-epic levels. I also don't kinda want to do rogue at all cause I think they're lame as hell :P Also Devastating critical is changed to 30 STR requirement. I have a version with EDR and one that goes all strength ish, but I am in need of input for them because I am newbie builder! Lots of un-optimized things like feat progression and skills progression. The reason I also have heal that high is cause our healing kits heal based off of our heal skill.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
It's a pity that you can't use CoT. That could have solved the saves problem. A charismatc Paladin gets high saves and Divine spells that help boost the power.
A completely different approach is to go full monk and focus on spell resistance.

posts.author: makiwoni
posts.content: Oh yeah a paladin, but I still feel that spells from deities are still magic heh. And yes monk actually has all high saves progression which I totally forgot but I was thinking more of a "soldier" type feeling with armor and a sword and board. I will continue pondering, thanks!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: A high-DEX Monk can have a lot of AC, and a Monk also gets Spell Resistance in addition to the high saves.
